preamble.longtitle: An Act to make provision for the drawing up of local energy conservation reports in relation to residential accommodation; to give the Secretary of State functions in connection therewith; and for related purposes.
preamble.enactment: Be it enacted by the Queen's most Excellent Majesty, by and with the advice and consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the authority of the same, as follows

content.leaf: Interpretation.In this Act—
Interpretation."energy conservation authority" means—
Interpretation.in England and Wales, a local housing authority within the meaning of the [1985 c. 68.] Housing Act 1985,
Interpretation.in Scotland, a local authority within the meaning of the [1987 c. 26.] Housing (Scotland) Act 1987, and
Interpretation.in Northern Ireland, the Northern Ireland Housing Executive;
Interpretation."energy conservation measures" includes information, advice, education, promotion, making grants and loans and carrying out works;
Interpretation."residential accommodation" means—
Interpretation.premises occupied or intended to be occupied as a separate dwelling and forming the whole or part of a building, or
Interpretation.a mobile home, that is—

Interpretation.in England and Wales or Scotland, a caravan within the meaning of Part I of the [1960 c. 62.] Caravan Sites and Control of Development Act 1960 (disregarding the amendment made by section 13(2) of the Caravan [1968 c. 52.] Sites Act 1968) which is a dwelling for the purposes of Part I or II of the [1992 c. 14.] Local Government Finance Act 1992,

Interpretation.in Northern Ireland, a caravan within the meaning of the [1963 c. 17 (N.I.).] Caravans Act (Northern Ireland) 1963 which is a dwelling-house for the purposes of the [S.I. 1977/2157 (N.I. 28).] Rates (Northern Ireland) Order 1977.
Interpretation.Any reference in this Act to the area of an energy conservation authority is—
Interpretation.in the case of a local housing authority in England and Wales, to the area of that authority within the meaning of the [1985 c. 68.] Housing Act 1985,
Interpretation.in the case of a local authority in Scotland, to the area of that authority, and
Interpretation.in the case of the Northern Ireland Housing Executive, to Northern Ireland.
Energy conservation reports.It shall be the duty of every energy conservation authority to prepare a report in accordance with this section.

Energy conservation reports.The report shall set out energy conservation measures that the authority considers practicable, cost-effective and likely to result in significant improvement in the energy efficiency of residential accommodation in its area.
Energy conservation reports.The report shall include—
Energy conservation reports.an assessment of the cost of the energy conservation measures set out in it;
Energy conservation reports.an assessment of the extent to which carbon dioxide emissions into the atmosphere would be decreased as a result of those measures; and

Energy conservation reports.a statement of any policy of the authority for taking into account, in deciding whether to exercise any power in connection with those measures, the personal circumstances of any person.

Energy conservation reports. Nothing in this subsection shall be taken as requiring the authority to set out in the report energy conservation measures to be taken in relation to any particular dwelling or building.
Energy conservation reports.The report may, if the energy conservation authority considers it desirable, include—

Energy conservation reports.an assessment of the extent of decreases in emissions into the atmosphere of oxides of nitrogen and sulphur dioxide which would result from the implementation of the measures set out in the report;
Energy conservation reports.an assessment of the number of jobs which would result from the implementation of those measures;

Energy conservation reports.an assessment of the average savings in fuel bills and in kilowatt hours of fuel used that might be expected to result from the measures by different types of household in different types of accommodation;
Energy conservation reports.such other matters as it considers appropriate.
Energy conservation reports.An energy conservation authority may in preparing the report consult such persons as it considers appropriate.
Energy conservation reports.When an energy conservation authority has prepared a report in accordance with this section, it shall publish it and send a copy to the Secretary of State.

leaf.margin: Functions of the Secretary of State in relation to reports.

content.leaf: Functions of the Secretary of State in relation to reports.The Secretary of State shall give directions as to the date by which reports under section 2 are to be sent to him by energy conservation authorities.
Functions of the Secretary of State in relation to reports.The directions may set different dates for different authorities, different descriptions of authority and different areas.

Functions of the Secretary of State in relation to reports.Where the Secretary of State has received a report under section 2 from an energy conservation authority, and it appears to him that the report has been duly prepared in accordance with this Act, he shall—

Functions of the Secretary of State in relation to reports.notify the authority of a timetable in accordance with which the authority shall prepare, publish and send to the Secretary of State reports on the progress made in implementing the measures set out in the report, and

Functions of the Secretary of State in relation to reports.take such steps as he considers desirable in order to assist with and to encourage other persons to assist with the measures set out in any such report.
Functions of the Secretary of State in relation to reports.The Secretary of State may vary any timetable set by him under subsection (2).
Functions of the Secretary of State in relation to reports.The Secretary of State shall from time to time prepare a report on—
Functions of the Secretary of State in relation to reports.the progress made by energy conservation authorities in implementing the measures set out in reports prepared under section 2, and
Functions of the Secretary of State in relation to reports.any steps he has taken pursuant to subsection (2)(b) above,
Functions of the Secretary of State in relation to reports.and shall lay any such report before Parliament.

leaf.margin: Guidance by the Secretary of State.

content.leaf: Guidance by the Secretary of State.The Secretary of State may, from time to time, give to energy conservation authorities such guidance as he considers appropriate in relation to the preparation of reports under section 2 or reports under section 3(2)(a).
Guidance by the Secretary of State.The Secretary of State may, in particular, give guidance as to what improvements in energy efficiency are to be regarded as significant.
Guidance by the Secretary of State.An energy conservation authority shall have regard to any guidance given by the Secretary of State under this section.

leaf.margin: Modification of report and further reports.

content.leaf: Modification of report and further reports.An energy conservation authority may, and if so directed by the Secretary of State shall—
Modification of report and further reports.modify the report prepared under section 2; or
Modification of report and further reports.prepare further reports setting out additional or modified energy conservation measures.

Modification of report and further reports.The provisions of subsections (2) to (6) of section 2, subsections (2) to (4) of section 3, section 4 and subsection (1) of this section apply in relation to any such modified or further report.
Supplementary provisions.Nothing in this Act shall be taken as conferring—
Supplementary provisions.any power to make grants or loans;
Supplementary provisions.any power of entry; or
Supplementary provisions.any power to carry out works, or require any person to carry out works.
Supplementary provisions.Nothing in this Act requires an energy conservation authority to inspect any premises or requires any person to give any information to an energy conservation authority.
Expenses.There shall be paid out of moneys provided by Parliament—
Expenses.any expenses of the Secretary of State under this Act; and
Expenses.any increase attributable to this Act in the sums payable out of such moneys under any other Act.
Northern Ireland.This Act extends to Northern Ireland.
Northern Ireland.In the application of this Act to Northern Ireland—
Northern Ireland.the references to the Secretary of State (except in section 7) shall be construed as references to the Department of the Environment for Northern Ireland;
Northern Ireland.the reference in section 3(4) to laying before Parliament shall be construed as a reference to laying before the Northern Ireland Assembly; and

Northern Ireland.the reference in section 9(2) to an order made by statutory instrument shall be construed as a reference to an order which is a statutory rule for the purposes of the [S.I. 1979/1573 (N.I. 12).] Statutory Rules (Northern Ireland) Order 1979.
Citation and commencement.This Act may be cited as the Home Energy Conservation Act 1995.
Citation and commencement.This Act shall come into force on such day as may be appointed by order made by statutory instrument by the Secretary of State.

Citation and commencement.Different days may be appointed under subsection (2) for different purposes, different energy conservation authorities, different descriptions of energy conservation authority and different areas.
